alert.note: Alert for Goshen (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 22 at 10:49PM MDT until June 23 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MDT FRIDAY... ...THIS REPLACES THE FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is ongoing. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Wyoming, including the following county, Goshen. * WHEN...Until 1100 AM MDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1049 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is still occurring in the advisory area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Ponding and high flows of small streams and washes in the area may continue overnight and into Friday morning. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... La Grange, Hawk Springs, Hawk Springs Recreation Area and Hawk Springs Campground. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
